title: Flask File Host
content:
Certainly! To create a simple application that hosts a folder using Python's built-in `http.server` module and allows file sharing among devices on the same WiFi network, you can use the Flask framework. Flask provides a convenient way to create web applications in Python. Here's a basic example: 1. First, install Flask if you haven't already. Open a terminal and run: ``` pip install Flask ``` 2. Create a file named `app.py` with the following content: ```python from flask import Flask, render_template, send_from_directory import socket import os app = Flask(__name__) @app.route('/') def index(): return render_template('index.html') @app.route('/files/') def download_file(filename): return send_from_directory('shared_folder', filename) if __name__ == '__main__': host_ip = socket.gethostbyname(socket.gethostname()) shared_folder_path = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), 'shared_folder') if not os.path.exists(shared_folder_path): os.makedirs(shared_folder_path) print(f"Server running on http://{host_ip}:5000/") app.run(host=host_ip, port=5000, debug=True) ``` 3. Create a folder named `templates` in the same directory as `app.py`. Inside the `templates` folder, create a file named `index.html` with the following content: ```html File Sharing App

File Sharing App

Access shared files from this link: Shared Files

``` 4. Run the application by executing the following command in the terminal: ``` python app.py ``` The server will start, and you can access the shared files through the link provided in the console, such as `http://:5000/files/`. Place the files you want to share in the `shared_folder` directory, and others on the same WiFi network can access them using the link provided by your server. Note: Make sure your firewall allows incoming connections to the specified port (default is 5000), and replace `` with the actual IP address of the hosting machine on the local network.
